skillTree.localised_description: Whether it is the genuine article or a replica made for her is unknown, but Skattach claims it to be the original throne of the mythical Hell-Mother, ruler of all Fimir. It is borne aloft by four of Skattach’s most trusted Fianna Guardians.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
Leadership is higher than 50% of base

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The swamp will rise again, its inhabitants enjoying the blessings of the Dark Gods once more.
The same enchanted mist that obscures Fimir Balefiend dwellings can also be conjured to confound and horrify would-be attackers on the battlefield.
Strange talismans and mouldy bone charms of the fens can often carry unique and unforeseen boons and side effects.

effects.description:
Spell resistance: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

Missile resistance: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: They can see the Winds of Magic's ebb and flow, enabling them to make the best use of the magical power available.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +4
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: The obscuring fog that shrouds the Fimir’s boggy fortresses follows them onto the battlefield, shielding them from more than just prying eyes and the harsh sun.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The Meargh are the respected and feared witch-queens of the Fimir. Skattach is at her prime as a Meargh, having ruled over her Clan for 800 hundred years.

From the moment took on the hated mantle of the Fimir Hell-Mother, Skattach keeps a personal guard of the most elite, skilled and loyal Fianna Fimm of her clan, lest any ambitious Dirach gets the wrong idea and tries to replace her with a more pliable Meargh.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Guardian" for Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -30% for Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: All Meargs naturally exude a magical mist that poisons and dazes all non-Fimir. Skattach's Mist is a particularly noxious one.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: After surviving an assassination attempt by one of her own Dirach advisers and subsequently being driven from her ancestral stronghold by humans, Skattach has descended into such a state of crazed megalomania that it has further empowered her already considerable magical abilities and natural resilience.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent in melee or casting spells.

skillTree.localised_description: Being one of the Meargh, Skattach is a fearsome sorceress, able to easily manipulate the Winds of Magic, and even lend some of her arcane acumen to the lesser Dirach males.

effects.description:
Range: +10% for Balefiend Apprentices units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Balefiend Apprentices units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir possess a natural aptitude for summoning daemons, said to come from their half-daemonic heritage. The Meargh summon them with ease, casually binding thousands of lesser daemons each day to serve as servants and warriors.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +15 for Moor Hounds, Swamp Daemons, Nuckelavees and Daemonomaniac units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Swamp Daemons

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Crude they may be, the skill and might of the Fimir Warriors makes them terrifying opponents.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Boglars, Shearls, Death-Quest and Fimm Warriors units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Boglars, Shearls, Death-Quest and Fimm Warriors units

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Boglars, Shearls, Death-Quest and Fimm Warriors units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir aren’t the fastest creatures, but they understand the value of mobility on the battlefield. Therefore, they tame the faster, corrupted, and dangerous beasts of their swampland homes to gain a tactical advantage.

effects.description:
Speed: +6% for Moor Hounds, Nuckelavees, Feral Bog Beasts and Bog Beast Raiders units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Moor Hounds, Nuckelavees, Feral Bog Beasts and Bog Beast Raiders units

	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Moor Hounds, Nuckelavees, Feral Bog Beasts and Bog Beast Raiders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The larger and stronger Fimir are used as shock troops, with devastating effect on the enemy.

Melee attack: +4 for Fianna Fimm units

skillTree.localised_description: The Fimir aren’t the only monsters inhabiting the swamps. Weaker or small-minded creatures are subjugated and used to bolster the ranks of Fimir armies.

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Furies, Swamp Daemons and Fen Beasts units

skillTree.localised_description: It's hard to aim with only one eye, but the Fimir still use limited numbers of ranged troops.

Missile strength: +4% for Shearl Mirestalkers, Balefiend Apprentices and Fog-Shrine of Balor units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir are often accompanied by bigger, more terrifying swamp dwellers. Make no mistake though, the Fimir are the masters of these creatures and will use them with ruthless cunning.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Bog Octopus, Jabberslythe and Daemonomaniac units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Bog Octopus, Jabberslythe and Daemonomaniac units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Bog Octopus, Jabberslythe and Daemonomaniac units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Few can hope to overcome the veterans of the warrior caste in battle. Luckily, they are few in number.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Boglars, Shearls, Death-Quest, Fimm Warriors and Fianna Fimm units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Boglars, Shearls, Death-Quest, Fimm Warriors and Fianna Fimm units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Boglars, Shearls, Death-Quest, Fimm Warriors and Fianna Fimm units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Starved monsters, driven by hatred and hunger. They will fight with reckless abandon against the foes of the Fimir.

Missile resistance: 15% for Shearl Mirestalkers, Swamp Daemons and Fen Beasts units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Shearl Mirestalkers, Swamp Daemons and Fen Beasts units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir are not famous for their hit and run tactics, partly because only a few who encounter them live to tell the tale.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Moor Hounds, Chaos Furies, Nuckelavees, Feral Bog Beasts and Bog Beast Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Nothing brings fear to the heart like the trembling of the ground these abominations cause with every step.

Armour: +12 for Balefiend Apprentices, Bog Octopus, Jabberslythe, Daemonomaniac and Fog-Shrine of Balor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 8% for Balefiend Apprentices, Bog Octopus, Daemonomaniac, Jabberslythe and Fog-Shrine of Balor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Balefiend Apprentices, Bog Octopus, Daemonomaniac, Jabberslythe and Fog-Shrine of Balor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
If there were annals detailing the dastardly deeds of the sackers and looters of the world, this inveterate brigand would feature heavily.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

effects.description: Unit Upgrades cost: -5% for all units
Unit Upgrades cost: -10% for all units

skillTree.localised_description: No act of faith among the Fimir rivals the sacrifice of captured slaves - a dark and twisted offering to the Mud-Father Fimúl and his children.
"This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +20% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +40% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: Maris’ presence is never absent. She sustains, she endures, and her children do not wither.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing precisely where and when to launch an ambush, and against who, takes an unusual level of guile.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
Leadership is higher than 50% of base

factionEffects.localised_description: "ME! ME! I SSSHALL BE RULER OF ALL FIMIR! THEN THE HU-MANSSS WILL FEAR USSS AGAIN! WE WILL RETAKE WHAT ISSS OURSSS! HELL-MOTHER SKATTACH SHALL RULE ALL!"

effects.description: The Rancor Hold Fimir are closely aligned with the Forces of Chaos and benefit from the Eye of the Gods and Gifts of Chaos mechanics, being able to sacrifice slaves to earn favour and rewards from the Chaos Gods.

items.colour_text: At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as Balor’s Eye - a magically preserved eye said to belong to the mysterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user’s enemies within.

This thorny metal crown once belonged to the First Hell-Mother - a Meargh who united all the ancient Fimir clans. She was a potent sorceress who placed many warding and magic-amplifying enchantments upon her crown. Skattach recently rediscovered it in what she claims to be the ruins of the Wandering Isle, the ancient lost homeland of the Fimir, and used it to claim the controversial mantle of the Hell-Mother.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as Balor’s Eye - a magically preserved eye said to belong to the mysterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user’s enemies within.

This thorny metal crown once belonged to the First Hell-Mother - a Meargh who united all the ancient Fimir clans. She was a potent sorceress who placed many warding and magic-amplifying enchantments upon her crown. Skattach recently rediscovered it in what she claims to be the ruins of the Wandering Isle, the ancient lost homeland of the Fimir, and used it to claim the controversial mantle of the Hell-Mother.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having been ousted from her fortress at Schadensumpf by the ever-encroaching humans, Skattach has descended into insanity. Having regrouped in the misty coasts of the northern Wastelands, she has crowned herself Hell-Mother, ruler of all Fimir.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Fimm Warriors and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 10% for Fimir Warriors and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)
